titleStmt.title: Peters patern or The perfect path to worldly happiness. As it was delivered in a funeral sermon preached at the interrment of Mr. Hugh Peters lately deceased, by I.C. translator of Pineda upon Job, and one of the triers.
titleStmt.author: J. C.
Caryl, Joseph, 1602-1673, attributed name.

notesStmt.note: A satire on Hugh Peters, who was charged with and executed for concerting the death of Charles I. The by-line has caused this work to be attributed to the great expositor of Job, Joseph Caryl. However, this attribution is highly unlikely, and the by-line is also satirical. Cf. Brinley cat., no. 637.
Partly in the same setting as Wing C783A.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
